name.text: 2.7.2.4 Study the graph of a rational function 2

questiontext.text:
Exercise

Consider the graph and the algebraic form of the rational function \(R_3(z)= \dfrac{2z^2+z-1}{(z-1)(z+2)}\).

  1. What happens to the function when \(z=-2\) and \(z=1\)? [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]
  2. Which values of \(z\) should be excluded from the domain of this function? [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]] [[feedback:prt2]]
  3. Substitute some values for \(z\) (e.g. \(10, 100...\)). What happens to \(R_3\) as \(z\) becomes larger and larger (namely, as \(z\) goes to infinity)? [[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]] [[feedback:prt3]]
  4. We can observe that the function \(R_3(z)\) has an horizontal asymptote. The equation of this asymptote is: \(y=\)[[input:ans4]] [[validation:ans4]] [[feedback:prt4]]
  5. What is the name given to the lines \(z=1\) and \(z=−2\)? [[input:ans5]] [[validation:ans5]] [[feedback:prt5]]

generalfeedback.text:
1. When \(z=-2\) and \(z=1\) the value of the function blows up to infinity because the denominator goes to zero (if we substitute \(z=-2\), for example, in \((z-1)(z+2)=(-2-1)(-2+2)=-3*0=0\)) . To be more precise, when we approach \(z=-2\) from the left and \(z=1\) from the right, the function approaches +∞. If instead we approach \(z=-2\) and \(z=1\) from the right and from the left respectively, the value of the function goes to \(- \infty\).
  2. The points \(z=-2\) and \(z=1\) are not in the domain since they represent singularities for the function (the denominator of the function is zero in these cases so the value of the function explodes).
  3. If you look at the graph you can notice that for positive and negative large values of \(z\) (\(z \to \pm \infty\)), the value of the function tends at a constant value.
  4. The constant value of the previous item is \(y=2\). This line is called to be an horizontal asymptot for the function.
  5. The lines \(z=1\) and \(z=−2\) are called vertical asymptotes.

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

testinput.name: ans1
testinput.value: "The denominator is zero, the function goes to infinity"
